etymology.description: 笨手 + 笨脚 = clumsy in actions and movement.
etymology.interpretation: Highlights awkwardness with both hands and feet; reduplication intensifies the sense of clumsiness and adds a colloquial tone.
etymology.simplification: Only 腳 was simplified to 脚 by adopting the simplified phonetic 却 (from 卻); 笨 and 手 remain unchanged.

parts.english: clumsy-handed; awkward with hands; ham-fisted; butterfingered
clumsy-footed; awkward on one's feet; ungainly; uncoordinated

examples.chinese: 他做家务时笨手笨脚(他做家務時笨手笨腳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuò jiāwù shí bènshǒu bènjiǎo.

examples.chinese: 别着急(別著急)，越紧张越会笨手笨脚(越緊張越會笨手笨腳)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zháojí, yuè jǐnzhāng yuè huì bènshǒu bènjiǎo.
examples.english: Don’t panic; the more nervous you get, the clumsier you become.

examples.chinese: 第一次上台(第一次上臺)，他走路和拿话筒都显得笨手笨脚(他走路和拿話筒都顯得笨手笨腳)。
examples.pinyin: Dì yī cì shàngtái, tā zǒulù hé ná huàtǒng dōu xiǎnde bènshǒu bènjiǎo.
examples.english: On his first time on stage, he walked and held the mic awkwardly.
